    <section class="bg-act-section padding-bottom-20">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <div class="text-center">
                    <h3>

                        The Civil Courts Act, 1887 

                        
                        
                    </h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            <h4 style="color: #fff;"> (
                                
                                    
                                    
                                        
                                            
                                            ACT
                                        
                                        NO. XII OF 1887
                                    
                                

                                )
                            </h4>
                        
                    
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="bt-act-section-search ">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-bottom12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <p class="pull-left no-print">
                    <a href="#" onclick="window.history.back();return false;"><i class="fa fa-arrow-left" title="Back"
                                                                                 aria-hidden="true"></i></a></p>
                <p class="pull-right print-center publish-date">
                    [ 11th March 1887   ]
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    
    <section
            class="padding-bottom-20 ">
        <div class="row margin-top-20 ">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12 lineremove">
                <button class="printIco print-only pull-right" onclick="window.print();return false;"
                        style="width: 72px;height: 80px;"><i
                        class="fa fa-print" style="font-size: 40px;"></i></button>
                
                    
                    
                        <div class="row">
                            <div class="text-center act-role-style">
                                
                                <strong>
                                    	<span class='footnote' href='#' title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words â€œBangladeshâ€, â€œGovernmentâ€, â€œTakaâ€ and "High Court Division" were substituted, for the words â€œEast Pakistanâ€, â€œProvincial Governmentâ€, â€œrupeesâ€ and "High Court" respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >1</a></sup></span></span>â™£An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to Civil Courts in Bangladesh.

                                    
                                    
                                </strong>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="row">
                            
                            <div class="col-md-12 pad-right">
                                <p>

                                    
                                    <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate and amend the law relating to Civil Courts in Bangladesh; It is hereby enacted as follows:- <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

                                    
                                    
                                </p>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    
                    
                
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter I

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                PRELIMINARY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Title, extent and commencement

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1. (1) This Act may be called the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œEast Bengalâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] Civil Courts Act.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) It extends to Bangladesh except such portions  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œthereofâ€ was substituted, for the words â€œof that provinceâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >3</a></sup></span></span>[thereof] as for the time being are not subject to the ordinary civil jurisdiction of the High Court Division  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œof East Pakistanâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >4</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]; and<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) It shall come into force on the first day of July, 1887. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    2. (1) <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œor East Bengal Civil Court Actâ€ were inserted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >5</a></sup></span></span>[Repealed by the Amendment Act, 1891 (Act No. XII of 1891)].<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) [Omitted by the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973), section 3 and 2nd Schedule.]<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) Any enactment or document referring to the Bengal Civil Courts Act, 1871,  [or East Bengal Civil Court Act] or to any enactment thereby repealed, shall be construed to refer to this Act or to the corresponding portion thereof. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter II

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                CONSTITUTION OF CIVIL COURTS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Classes of Civil Courts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p><span class='footnote'  title='Section 3 was substituted, for section 3 by section 2 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >6</a></sup></span></span>[3. There shall be following classes of Civil Courts, namely:-</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(a) the Court of the District Judge;</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(b) the Court of the Additional District Judge;</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(c) the Court of the Joint District Judge;</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(d) the Court of the Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 2 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >7</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge; and</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(e) the Court of the <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 2 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >8</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge.]</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Number of Judges

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p><span class='footnote'  title='Section 4 was substituted, for section 3 by section 3 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >9</a></sup></span></span>[4. The Government may alter the number of District Judges, Additional District Judges, Joint District Judges, Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 3 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >10</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges and <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >11</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges now fixed.]</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. [Repealed by the Decentralization Act, 1914 (Act No. IV of 1914).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Vacancies among District or Joint District Judges

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    6. (1) Whenever the office of District Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >12</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge is vacant by reason of the death, resignation or removal of the Judge or other cause, or whenever an increase in the number of District or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >13</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judges has been made under the provisions of section 4, the Government or, as the case<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>may be, the High Court Division may fill up the vacancy or appoint the Additional District Judges or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >14</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judges.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent a Government from appointing a District Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >15</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge to discharge, for such period as it thinks fit, in addition to the functions devolving on him as such District Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >16</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge, all or any of the functions of another District Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='6' >17</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge, as the case may be. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    7. [Omitted by the Government of India (Adaptation of Indian Laws) Order, 1937.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Additional District Judges

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    8.(1) When the business pending before any District Judge requires the aid of  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >18</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judges for its speedy disposal, the Government may, having consulted the High Court Division, appoint such  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >19</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judges as may be requisite.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >20</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judges so appointed shall discharge any of the functions of a District Judge which the District Judge may assign to them, and, in the discharge of those functions, they shall exercise the same powers as the District Judge. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Administrative control of Courts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    9. Subject to the superintendence of the High Court Division, the District Judge shall have administrative control over all the Civil Courts under this Act within the local limits of his jurisdiction. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Temporary charge of District Court

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    10. (1) In the event of the death, resignation or removal of the District Judge, or of his being incapacitated by illness or otherwise for the performance of his duties, or of his absence from the place at which his Court is held, the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >21</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judges, or, if an  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >22</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge is not present at that place, the senior  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 6 and 7 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >23</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge present thereat, shall, without relinquishing his ordinary duties, assume charge of the office of the District Judge, and shall continue in charge thereof until the office is resumed by the District Judge or assumed by an officer appointed thereto.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) While in charge of the office of the District Judge, the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >24</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 6 and 7 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >25</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge, as the case may be, may, subject to any rules which the High Court Division may make in this behalf, exercise any of the powers of the District Judge.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            		Transfer of proceedings on vacation of office of Joint 	District Judge

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    11. (1) In the event of the death, resignation or removal of a  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 6 and 7 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >26</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge, or of his being incapacitated by illness or otherwise for the performance of his duties, or of his absence from the place at which his Court is held, the District Judge may transfer all or any of the proceedings pending in the Court of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 6 and 7 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >27</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge either to his own Court or to any Court under his administrative control competent to dispose of them.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Proceedings transferred under sub-section (1) shall be disposed of as if they had been instituted in the Court to which they are so transferred:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) Provided that the District Judge may re-transfer to the Court of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 7 and 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >28</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge or his successor any proceedings transferred under sub-section (1) to his own or any other Court.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) For the purposes of proceedings which are not pending in the Court of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 7 and 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >29</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge on the occurrence of an event referred to in sub-section (1), and with respect to which that Court has exclusive jurisdiction, the District Judge may exercise all or any of the jurisdiction of that Court.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    12. [Omitted by the Government of India (Adaptation of Indian Laws) Order, 1937.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Power to fix local limits of jurisdiction of Courts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>13. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, fix and alter the local limits of the jurisdiction of any Civil Court under this Act.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(2) If the same local jurisdiction is assigned to two or more <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 7 and 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >30</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judges or to two or more <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judges or Assistant Judgesâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgesâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >31</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >32</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >33</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges], the District Judge may assign to each of them such civil business cognizable by the <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 7 and 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >34</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='6' >35</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='7' >36</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='8' >37</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge], as the case may be, as, subject to any general or special orders of the High Court Division, he thinks fit.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(3) When civil business arising in any local area is assigned by the District Judge under sub-section (2) to one of two or more <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='9' >38</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judges or to one of two or more <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judges or Assistant Judgesâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgesâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='10' >39</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='11' >40</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='12' >41</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges], a decree or order passed by the <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='13' >42</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='14' >43</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='15' >44</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='16' >45</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge] shall not be invalid by reason only of the case in which it was made having arisen wholly or in part in a place beyond the local area if that place is within the local limits fixed by the Government under sub-section (I).</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(4) A Judge of a Court of Small Causes appointed to be also a <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint District Judge or Senior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judge is a Joint District Judge or Senior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œSubordinate Judge or Assistant Judge is a Subordinate Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='17' >46</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District Judge or Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='18' >47</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='19' >48</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge is a Joint District Judge or Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='20' >49</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 4 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='21' >50</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge], as the case may be, within the meaning of this section.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(5) The present local limits of the jurisdiction of every Civil Court under this Act shall be deemed to have been fixed under this section.</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Place of sitting of Courts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    14. (1) The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, fix and alter the place or places at which any Civil Court under this Act is to be held.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) All places at which any such Courts are now held shall be deemed to have been fixed under this section.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Vacations of Courts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    15. (1) Subject to such orders as may be made by the Government the High Court Division shall prepare a list of days to be observed in each year as closed holidays in the Civil Courts.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The list shall be published in the official Gazette.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) A judicial act done by a Civil Court on a day specified in the list shall not be invalid by reason only of its having been done on that day.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Seals of Courts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    16. Every Civil Court under this Act shall use a seal of such form and dimensions as are prescribed by the Government.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            		Continuance of proceedings of Courts ceasing to have 	jurisdiction

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    17. (1) Where any Civil Court under this Act has from any cause ceased to have jurisdiction with respect to any case, any proceedings in relation to that case which, if that Court had not ceased to have jurisdiction, might have been had therein may be had in the Court to which the business of the former Court has been transferred.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Nothing in this section applies to cases for which provision is made in sections 36, 37 and 114 of, and rule 1 of Order XLVII in Schedule I to the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a>, or in any other enactment for the time being in force.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter III

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                ORDINARY JURISDICTION	

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Extent of original jurisdiction of District or Joint District 	Judge

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    18. Save as otherwise provided by any enactment for the time being in force, the jurisdiction of a District Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >51</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge extends, subject to the provisions of section 15 of the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a> to all original suits for the time being cognizable by Civil Courts. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Extent of jurisdiction of Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >52</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge, etc.

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p><span class='footnote'  title='Section 19 was substituted by section 2 of The Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021 (Act No. V of 2021).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >53</a></sup></span></span>[19. (1) Save as otherwise provided by any enactment for the time being in force, the jurisdiction of a Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >54</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge and <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œa Civilâ€ were substituted for the words â€œan Assistantâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >55</a></sup></span></span>[a Civil] Judge shall extend to all suits of which the value does not exceed 25 (twenty five) lac Taka and 15 (fifteen) lac Taka respectively.</p>

<p>(2) The District Judge shall transfer the suit or proceeding pending before the Joint District Judge Court or the Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >56</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge Court to the competent court within 90 (ninety) days from the date of enforcement of the <a title='Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021' href='/act-1370.html'>Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021</a>.</p>

<p>(3) If any suit or proceeding is transferred under sub-section (2), the suit or proceeding shall start from the stage at which it was transferred.]</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		<span class='footnote'  title='The marginal heading was substituted, for the former marginal heading by section 11 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >57</a></sup></span></span>[Appeal from District and Additional District Judges]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    20. (1) Save as otherwise provided by any enactment for the time being in force, an appeal from a decree or order of a District Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 11 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >58</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge shall lie to the High Court Division.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) An appeal shall not lie to the High Court Division from a decree or order of an  <span class='footnote'  title='The marginal heading was substituted, for the former marginal heading by section 11 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >59</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge in any case in which, if the decree or order had been made by the District Judge, an appeal would not lie to that Court.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             <span class='footnote'  title='The marginal heading was substituted, for the former marginal heading by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >60</a></sup></span></span>[Appeal from Joint District Judge, etc.]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>21.<span class='footnote'  title='Sub-section (1) and (1A) were substituted by section 3 of The Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021 (Act No. V of 2021).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >61</a></sup></span></span>[(1) Save as aforesaid, an appeal from a decree or order of a Joint District Judge shall lie-</p>

<p>(a) to the District Judge where the value of the original suit in which or in any proceeding arising out of which the decree or order was made did not exceed 5 (five) crore Taka; and</p>

<p>(b) to the High Court Division in any other case.</p>

<p>(1A) No appeal or proceeding pending before the High Court Division shall be transferred to the District Judge only because of the enhancement of pecuniary jurisdiction of a District Judge by the <a title='Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021' href='/act-1370.html'>Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021</a>.]</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(2) Save as aforesaid, an appeal from a decree or order of a <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or an Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >62</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >63</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œa Civilâ€ were substituted for the words â€œan Assistantâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >64</a></sup></span></span>[a Civil] Judge] shall lie to the District Judge.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(3) Where the function of receiving any appeals which lie to the District Judge under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) has been assigned to an <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >65</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge, the appeals may be preferred to the <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='6' >66</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(4) The High Court Division may, with the previous sanction of the Government, direct, by notification in the official Gazette, that appeals lying to the District Judge under sub-section (2) from all or any of the decrees or orders of any <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or an Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='7' >67</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='8' >68</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œa Civilâ€ were substituted for the words â€œan Assistantâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='9' >69</a></sup></span></span>[a Civil] Judge], shall be preferred to the Court of such <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 12 and 13 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='10' >70</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge as may be mentioned in the notification, and the appeals shall thereupon be preferred accordingly.</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter IV

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                SPECIAL JURISDICTION

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	 <span class='footnote'  title='The marginal heading was substituted, for marginal heading by section 13 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >71</a></sup></span></span>[Power of District Judge to transfer appeals]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>22.(1)&nbsp; A District Judge may transfer to any <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 12 and 13 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >72</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge under his administrative control any appeals pending before him from the decrees or orders of <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judges or Assistant Judgesâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgesâ€ by section 13 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >73</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 7 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >74</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 7 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >75</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges].(2) The District Judge may withdraw any appeal so transferred, and either hear and depose of it himself or transfer it to a Court under his administrative control competent to dispose of it.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(3) Appeals transferred under this section shall be disposed of subject to the rules applicable to like appeals when disposed of by the District Judge.</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Exercise by Joint District Judge or Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >76</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge  or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >77</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge of Jurisdiction of District Court in 	certain proceedings

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>23.(1) The High Court Division may, by general or special order, authorise any <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 14 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >78</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] control, any of the proceedings next hereinafter mentioned or any class of those proceedings specified in the order.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(2) The proceedings referred to in sub-section (1) are the following, namely:-</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(a) Proceedings under the Bengal Wills and Intestacy Regulation, 1799;</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(b)-(c) [Repealed by the <a title='Guardians and Wards Act, 1890' href='/act-64.html'>Guardians and Wards Act, 1890</a> (Act VIII of 1890).]</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(d) Proceedings under the <a title='Succession Act, 1925' href='/act-138.html'>Succession Act, 1925</a>, which cannot be disposed of by District Delegates; and</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p><span class='footnote'  title='Sub-clause (e) was omitted by section 6(2) of the Bengal, Agra and Assam Civil Courts (Bengal Amendment) Act, 1935.'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='10' >86</a></sup></span></span>[* * *].&nbsp; (3) The District Judge may withdraw any such proceedings taken cognizance of by, or transferred to, a <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='11' >87</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='12' >88</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='13' >89</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='14' >90</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge], and may either himself dispose of them or transfer them to a Court under his administrative control competent to dispose of them.</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">

                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>24. (1) Proceedings taken cognizance of by, or transferred to, a <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >91</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >92</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >93</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >94</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge], as the case may be, under the last foregoing section shall be disposed of by him subject to the rules applicable to like proceedings when disposed of by the District Judge:</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>Provided that an appeal from an order of a <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >95</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='6' >96</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='7' >97</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge] in any such proceeding shall lie to the District Judge.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(2) An appeal from the order of the District Judge on the Appeal from the order of the <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='8' >98</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='9' >99</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='10' >100</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge] under this section shall lie to the High Court Division if a further appeal from the order of the District Judge is allowed by the law for the time being in force.</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
