                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                ORDINARY JURISDICTION	

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Extent of original jurisdiction of District or Joint District 	Judge

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    18. Save as otherwise provided by any enactment for the time being in force, the jurisdiction of a District Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >51</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge extends, subject to the provisions of section 15 of the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a> to all original suits for the time being cognizable by Civil Courts. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Extent of jurisdiction of Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >52</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge, etc.

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p><span class='footnote'  title='Section 19 was substituted by section 2 of The Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021 (Act No. V of 2021).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >53</a></sup></span></span>[19. (1) Save as otherwise provided by any enactment for the time being in force, the jurisdiction of a Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >54</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge and <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œa Civilâ€ were substituted for the words â€œan Assistantâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >55</a></sup></span></span>[a Civil] Judge shall extend to all suits of which the value does not exceed 25 (twenty five) lac Taka and 15 (fifteen) lac Taka respectively.</p>

<p>(2) The District Judge shall transfer the suit or proceeding pending before the Joint District Judge Court or the Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 5 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >56</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge Court to the competent court within 90 (ninety) days from the date of enforcement of the <a title='Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021' href='/act-1370.html'>Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021</a>.</p>

<p>(3) If any suit or proceeding is transferred under sub-section (2), the suit or proceeding shall start from the stage at which it was transferred.]</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		<span class='footnote'  title='The marginal heading was substituted, for the former marginal heading by section 11 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >57</a></sup></span></span>[Appeal from District and Additional District Judges]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    20. (1) Save as otherwise provided by any enactment for the time being in force, an appeal from a decree or order of a District Judge or  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 11 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >58</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge shall lie to the High Court Division.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) An appeal shall not lie to the High Court Division from a decree or order of an  <span class='footnote'  title='The marginal heading was substituted, for the former marginal heading by section 11 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >59</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge in any case in which, if the decree or order had been made by the District Judge, an appeal would not lie to that Court.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             <span class='footnote'  title='The marginal heading was substituted, for the former marginal heading by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >60</a></sup></span></span>[Appeal from Joint District Judge, etc.]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>21.<span class='footnote'  title='Sub-section (1) and (1A) were substituted by section 3 of The Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021 (Act No. V of 2021).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >61</a></sup></span></span>[(1) Save as aforesaid, an appeal from a decree or order of a Joint District Judge shall lie-</p>

<p>(a) to the District Judge where the value of the original suit in which or in any proceeding arising out of which the decree or order was made did not exceed 5 (five) crore Taka; and</p>

<p>(b) to the High Court Division in any other case.</p>

<p>(1A) No appeal or proceeding pending before the High Court Division shall be transferred to the District Judge only because of the enhancement of pecuniary jurisdiction of a District Judge by the <a title='Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021' href='/act-1370.html'>Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2021</a>.]</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(2) Save as aforesaid, an appeal from a decree or order of a <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or an Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >62</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >63</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œa Civilâ€ were substituted for the words â€œan Assistantâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >64</a></sup></span></span>[a Civil] Judge] shall lie to the District Judge.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(3) Where the function of receiving any appeals which lie to the District Judge under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) has been assigned to an <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >65</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge, the appeals may be preferred to the <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œAdditional Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œAdditionalâ€ by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='6' >66</a></sup></span></span>[Additional District] Judge.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(4) The High Court Division may, with the previous sanction of the Government, direct, by notification in the official Gazette, that appeals lying to the District Judge under sub-section (2) from all or any of the decrees or orders of any <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or an Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by section 12 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='7' >67</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='8' >68</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œa Civilâ€ were substituted for the words â€œan Assistantâ€ by section 6 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='9' >69</a></sup></span></span>[a Civil] Judge], shall be preferred to the Court of such <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 12 and 13 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='10' >70</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge as may be mentioned in the notification, and the appeals shall thereupon be preferred accordingly.</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

                                SPECIAL JURISDICTION

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	 <span class='footnote'  title='The marginal heading was substituted, for marginal heading by section 13 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >71</a></sup></span></span>[Power of District Judge to transfer appeals]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <p>22.(1)&nbsp; A District Judge may transfer to any <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 12 and 13 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >72</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge under his administrative control any appeals pending before him from the decrees or orders of <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judges or Assistant Judgesâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgesâ€ by section 13 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >73</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 7 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >74</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 7 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >75</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judges].(2) The District Judge may withdraw any appeal so transferred, and either hear and depose of it himself or transfer it to a Court under his administrative control competent to dispose of it.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(3) Appeals transferred under this section shall be disposed of subject to the rules applicable to like appeals when disposed of by the District Judge.</p>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >81</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge] to take cognizance of, or any District Judge to transfer to a <span class='footnote'  title='The control, any of the proceedings next hereinafter mentioned or any class of those proceedings specified in the order.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(2) The proceedings referred to in sub-section (1) are the following, namely:-</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(a) Proceedings under the Bengal Wills and Intestacy Regulation, 1799;</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(b)-(c) [Repealed by the <a title='Guardians and Wards Act, 1890' href='/act-64.html'>Guardians and Wards Act, 1890</a> (Act VIII of 1890).]</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(d) Proceedings under the <a title='Succession Act, 1925' href='/act-138.html'>Succession Act, 1925</a>, which cannot be disposed of by District Delegates; and</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p><span class='footnote'  title='Sub-clause (e) was omitted by section 6(2) of the Bengal, Agra and Assam Civil Courts (Bengal Amendment) Act, 1935.'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='10' >86</a></sup></span></span>[* * *].&nbsp; (3) The District Judge may withdraw any such proceedings taken cognizance of by, or transferred to, a <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œJoint Districtâ€ were substituted, for the word â€œSubordinateâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='11' >87</a></sup></span></span>[Joint District] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='12' >88</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='13' >89</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 8 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='14' >90</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge], and may either himself dispose of them or transfer them to a Court under his administrative control competent to dispose of them.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>Provided that an appeal from an order of a <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='5' >95</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='6' >96</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='7' >97</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge] in any such proceeding shall lie to the District Judge.</p>

<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

<div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

<p>(2) An appeal from the order of the District Judge on the Appeal from the order of the <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSenior Assistant Judge or Assistant Judgeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œAssistant Judgeâ€ by sections 14, 15 and 16 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Act, 2001 (Act No. XLIX of 2001).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='8' >98</a></sup></span></span>[Senior <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='9' >99</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge or <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œCivilâ€ was substituted for the word â€œAssistantâ€ by section 9 of the Civil Courts (Amendment) Ordinance, 2025 (Ordinance No. LV of 2025).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='10' >100</a></sup></span></span>[Civil] Judge] under this section shall lie to the High Court Division if a further appeal from the order of the District Judge is allowed by the law for the time being in force.</p>

                                SUPPLEMENTAL PROVISIONS

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Power to confer powers of Civil Courts on officers

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    36. (1) The Government may invest with the powers of any Civil Court under this Act, by name or in virtue of office,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Clause (a) [Omitted by the Governor General Order 4 of 1949, Schedule.]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b) 	after consultation with the High Court Division any officer serving in any part of the territories to which this Act extends and belonging to a class defined in this behalf by the Government.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Nothing in sections 4, 5, 6, 8. 10 or 11 applies to any officer so invested, but all the other provisions of this Act shall, so far as those provisions can be made applicable, apply to him as if he were a Judge of the Court with the powers of which he is invested.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) [Omitted by East Pakistan (Amendment) Ordinance, 1962 (Ordinance No. XIII of 1962).]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) Where the place at which the Court of an officer invested with powers under sub-section (1) is to be held has not been fixed under section 14, the Court may be held at any place within the local limits of its jurisdiction.

                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    37.(1) Where in any suit or other proceeding it is necessary for a Civil Court to decide any question regarding succession, inheritance, marriage or caste, or any religious usage or institution, the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œMuslimâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œMuhammadanâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >115</a></sup></span></span>[Muslim] law in cases where the parties are  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œMuslimâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œMuhammadanâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >116</a></sup></span></span>[Muslim], and the Hindu law in cases where the parties are Hindus, shall form the rule of decision except in so far as such law has, by legislative enactment, been altered or abolished.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) In cases not provided for by sub-section (1) or by any other law for the time being in force, the Court shall act according to justice, equity and good conscience.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Judges not to try suits in which they are interested

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    38. (1) The presiding officer of a Civil Court shall not try any suit or other proceeding to which he is a party or in which he is personally interested.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The presiding officer of an appellate Civil Court under this Act shall not try an appeal against a decree or order passed by himself in another capacity.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) When any such suit, proceeding or appeal as is referred to in sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) comes before any such officer, the officer shall forthwith transmit the record of the case to the Court to which he is immediately subordinate, with a report of the circumstances attending the reference.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) The superior Court shall thereupon dispose of the case under  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, figures and comma â€œsection 24 of the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908â€ were substituted, for the words and figure â€œsection 25 of the Code of Civil Procedureâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >117</a></sup></span></span>[section 24 of the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a>].<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) Nothing in this section shall be deemed to affect the extraordinary original civil jurisdiction of the High Court Division. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Subordination of Courts to District Court

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    39. For the purposes of the last foregoing section the presiding officer of a Court subject to the administrative control of the District Judge shall be deemed to be immediately subordinate to the Court of the District Judge, and, for the purposes of the Code of Civil Procedure 1908, the Court of such an officer shall be deemed to be of a grade inferior to that of the Court of the District Judge. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             		Application of Act to Courts of Small Causes

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    40.(1) This section and sections 15, 32, 37, 38 and 39 apply to Courts of Small Causes constituted under the  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œProvincialâ€ was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >118</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] <a title='Small Cause Courts Act, 1887' href='/act-58.html'>Small Cause Courts Act, 1887</a>.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Save as provided by that Act, the other sections of this Act do not apply to those Courts. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

<script>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

        $(document).ready(function($) {
            $('body').scrollToTop({
                distance: 200,
                speed: 1000,
                easing: 'linear',
                animation: 'fade', // fade, slide, none
                animationSpeed: 500,

                mobile: {
                    width: 768,
                    distance: 100,
                    speed: 1000,
                    easing: 'easeInOutElastic',
                    animation: 'slide',
                    animationSpeed: 200
                },

                trigger: null, // Set a custom triggering element. Can be an HTML string or jQuery object
                target: null, // Set a custom target element for scrolling to. Can be element or number
                text: '<i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-up" aria-hidden="true"></i>Top', // Text for element, can contain HTML

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

<script>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

        $(document).ready(function($) {
            $('body').scrollToTop({
                distance: 200,
                speed: 1000,
                easing: 'linear',
                animation: 'fade', // fade, slide, none
                animationSpeed: 500,

                mobile: {
                    width: 768,
                    distance: 100,
                    speed: 1000,
                    easing: 'easeInOutElastic',
                    animation: 'slide',
                    animationSpeed: 200
                },

                trigger: null, // Set a custom triggering element. Can be an HTML string or jQuery object
                target: null, // Set a custom target element for scrolling to. Can be element or number
                text: '<i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-up" aria-hidden="true"></i>Top', // Text for element, can contain HTML

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

<div class="col-md-11 boxed-layout " style="padding: 10px;width: 97%">
    <section class="bg-act-section padding-bottom-20">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <div class="text-center">
                    <h3>

                        The Metal Tokens Act, 1889 

                        
                        
                    </h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            <h4 style="color: #fff;"> (
                                
                                    
                                    
                                        
                                            
                                            ACT
                                        
                                        NO. I OF 1889
                                    
                                

                                )
                            </h4>
                        
                    
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="bt-act-section-search ">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-bottom12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <p class="pull-left no-print">
                    <a href="#" onclick="window.history.back();return false;"><i class="fa fa-arrow-left" title="Back"
                                                                                 aria-hidden="true"></i></a></p>
                <p class="pull-right print-center publish-date">
                    [ 1st February, 1889   ]
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    
    <section
            class="padding-bottom-20 ">
        <div class="row margin-top-20 ">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12 lineremove">
                <button class="printIco print-only pull-right" onclick="window.print();return false;"
                        style="width: 72px;height: 80px;"><i
                        class="fa fa-print" style="font-size: 40px;"></i></button>
                
                    
                    
                        <div class="row">
                            <div class="text-center act-role-style">
                                
                                <strong>
                                    <span class='footnote' href='#' title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words â€œBangladeshâ€ and â€œGovernmentâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistanâ€ and â€œCentral Governmentâ€ respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >1</a></sup></span></span>â™£An Act for the Protection of Coinage and other purposes

                                    
                                    
                                </strong>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="row">
                            
                            <div class="col-md-12 pad-right">
                                <p>

                                    
                                    <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>WHEREAS it is expedient to prohibit the making, or the possession for issue or the issue, by private persons, of pieces of metal for use as money; <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='Second paragraph of the Preamble was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>It is hereby enacted as follows:-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div> <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

                                    
                                    
                                </p>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    
                    
                
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            Title and extent

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1.(1) This Act may be called the <a title='Metal Tokens Act, 1889' href='/act-60.html'>Metal Tokens Act, 1889</a>.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) [Repealed by section 3 and Schedule II of the Repealing and Amending Act, 1914 (Act No. X of 1914).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            Definition

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    2. In this Act â€œissueâ€ means to put a piece of metal into circulation for the first time for use as money in Bangladesh such piece having been made in contravention of this Act or brought into Bangladesh by sea or by land in contravention of any notification for the time being in force under  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, figures and comma â€œsection 16 of the Customs Act, 1969â€ were substituted, for the words, figures and comma â€œsection 19 of the Sea Customs Act, 1878â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >3</a></sup></span></span>[section 16 of the <a title='Customs Act, 1969' href='/act-354.html'>Customs Act, 1969</a>]. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            Prohibition of making by private persons of pieces of metal to be used as money

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    3. No piece of copper or bronze or of any other metal or mixed metal, which, whether stamped or unstamped, is intended to be used as money, shall be made except by the authority of the Government. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            Penalty for unlawful making, issue or possession of such pieces

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    4. (1) In either of the following cases, namely:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	if any person makes in contravention of the last foregoing section, or issues or attempts to issue, any such piece as is mentioned in that section,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	if, after the expiration of three months from the commencement of this Act, any person has in his possession, custody or control any such piece as is mentioned in the last foregoing section, with intent to issue the piece, the person shall be punished,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(i)	if he has not been previously convicted under this section, with imprisonment which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(ii)	if he has been previously convicted under this section, with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) If any person is convicted of an offence under sub-section (1), he shall, in addition to any other punishment to which he may be sentenced, forfeit all such pieces as aforesaid, and all instruments and materials for the making of such pieces, which may have been found in his possession, custody or control.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) If in the trial of any such offence the question arises whether any piece of metal or mixed metal was intended to be used or to be issued for use as money, the burden of proving that the piece was not intended to be so used or issued shall lie on the accused person.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            Cognizance of offences under the last foregoing section

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. (1) The offence of making, in contravention of section 3, any such piece as is mentioned in that section shall be a cognizable offence.(2) Notwithstanding anything in the Code of Criminal Procedure,  <span class='footnote'  title='The figure â€œ1898â€ was substituted, for the figure â€œ1882â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >4</a></sup></span></span>[1898] no other offence punishable under section 4 shall be a cognizable offence, or be taken cognizance of by any Magistrate, except a District Magistrate or Sub-Divisional Magistrate, without the previous sanction of the District Magistrate or Sub-Divisional Magistrate. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            Application of certain of the foregoing provisions of this Act to importation of pieces of metal for use as money

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    6. If at any time the Government sees fit, by notification under  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, figures and comma â€œsection 16 of the Customs Act, 1969â€ were substituted, for the words, figures and comma â€œSection 19 of the Sea Customs Act, 1878â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >5</a></sup></span></span>[section 16 of the <a title='Customs Act, 1969' href='/act-354.html'>Customs Act, 1969</a>], to prohibit or restrict the bringing by sea or by land into Bangladesh of any such pieces of metal as are mentioned in section 3, it may by the notification direct that any person contravening the prohibition or restriction shall be liable to the punishment to which he would be liable if he were convicted under this Act of making such pieces in Bangladesh instead of to the penalty mentioned in  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, figures and comma â€œsection 156 of the Customs Act, 1969â€ were substituted, for the words, comma and figure â€œsection 167 of the Sea Customs Act, 1878â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >6</a></sup></span></span>[section 156 of the <a title='Customs Act, 1969' href='/act-354.html'>Customs Act, 1969</a>], and that the provisions of sub-section (3) of section 4 and sub-section (1) of section 5, or of either sub-section, in relation to the offence of making such pieces shall, notwithstanding anything in the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, comma and figure â€œCustoms Act, 1969â€ were substituted, for the words, comma and figure â€œSea Customs Act, 1878â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >7</a></sup></span></span>[<a title='Customs Act, 1969' href='/act-354.html'>Customs Act, 1969</a>], apply, so far as they can be made applicable, to the offence of contravening the prohibition or restriction notified under  <span class='footnote'  title='The word and figure â€œsection 16â€ were substituted, for the word and figure â€œsection 19â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='4' >8</a></sup></span></span>[section 16] of that Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            [Repealed ]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    7. [Repealed by the <a title='Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898' href='/act-75.html'>Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898</a> 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(Act No. V of 1898).]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            Prohibition of receipt by local authorities and railways as money of metal which is not coin

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    8. (1) No piece of metal which is not coin as defined in the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >9</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code] shall be received as money by or on behalf of any railway-administration or local authority. <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) If any person on behalf of a railway-administration, or on behalf of a local authority, or on behalf of the lessee of the collection of any toll or other impost leviable by a railway-administration or local authority, receives as money any piece of metal which is not such coin as aforesaid, he shall be punished with fine which may extend to ten  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œTakaâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œrupeesâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >10</a></sup></span></span>[Taka]. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            [Repealed ]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    9. [Repealed by the Repealing Act, 1938 (Act No. I of 1938), section 2 and Schedule.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

    function onSubmit(token) {

<script>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

        $(document).ready(function($) {
            $('body').scrollToTop({
                distance: 200,
                speed: 1000,
                easing: 'linear',
                animation: 'fade', // fade, slide, none
                animationSpeed: 500,

                mobile: {
                    width: 768,
                    distance: 100,
                    speed: 1000,
                    easing: 'easeInOutElastic',
                    animation: 'slide',
                    animationSpeed: 200
                },

                trigger: null, // Set a custom triggering element. Can be an HTML string or jQuery object
                target: null, // Set a custom target element for scrolling to. Can be element or number
                text: '<i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-up" aria-hidden="true"></i>Top', // Text for element, can contain HTML

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

        });*/
